programme.title: Nuclear Test Films
programme.desc: Footage from the 1956 Operation Redwing, a nuclear test with 17 detonations.

programme.title: Nuclear Test Films
programme.desc: Footage from the 1956 Operation Redwing, a nuclear test with 17 detonations.

programme.title: 1945-1953: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Learn how, after being brothers in arms during World War II, the Allies would soon become divided in peace. How did a post-war conference in Crimea lead to the Cold War?

programme.title: 1945-1953: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Hear how the Yalta Conference of 1945 - in which Franklin D Roosevelt, Winston Churchill and Joseph Stalin met to discuss Europe's post-war reorganization - led to enmity.

programme.title: Cold War: Combat Machines and Weapons
programme.desc: The Cold War was a uniquely dangerous period in human history as East and West developed weapons that could destroy the world. We look at the origins of the Arms Race and the first use of nuclear weapons that ended WW2. We examine the frantic build-up of nuclear arsenals and feature key developments like the Titan II ICBM and the Corona spy satellite.

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: 3 Days in the Life of Lt. Kravtsov
programme.desc: This story underscores the harsh realities of war and the profound impact it has on young soldiers like Lt. Kravtsov. It raises questions about sacrifice, the fragility of life, and the emotional toll of warfare. Will Lt. Kravtsov defy the odds and survive his assigned three days? The answer remains uncertain in this poignant narrative of youth and the cost of war.

programme.title: Combat War Channel
programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: Heroes Never Die: The Miniseries
programme.desc: With English Closed Captions. A group of Ukrainian Army fighters heads to Donetsk airport for its defense. After being shelled by artillery on the way, a team of four volunteer fighters makes it to the airport to help reinforce. The name Cyborgs, Defenders of the Donetsk Airport, is given to the Ukrainian fighters for their grit, bravery and heroics.

programme.desc: Valley Forge...Gettysburg...Wounded Knee...San Juan Hill...the Somme...Omaha Beach...Inchon...Saigon...Basra. Combat War Channel delivers the complete history of America and our allies at war as never before!

programme.title: 3 Days in the Life of Lt. Kravtsov
programme.desc: Lt. Kravtsov, a platoon commander, begins his active duty. The odds are against him, as lieutenants typically have only three days to live. Within this time, he must lead his troops in a futile attack, hoping to save the incoming regiment. Can he survive these three days?

programme.title: 3 Days in the Life of Lt. Kravtsov
programme.desc: Lt. Kravtsov's mission demands him to quickly assume command and guide his troops through treacherous circumstances. With limited time, he faces the immense challenge of maintaining morale, making tough decisions, and protecting his men in the face of overwhelming odds.

programme.title: The Destiny of Rome
programme.desc: The Battle of Philippi in 42 BC would change the world forever. Marc Antony and Octavian sought to avenge Caesar, but later fought over his legacy, with the fate of Rome in the balance. They first managed to combine their forces to punish Brutus and Cassius, Caesar's assassins, and to proclaim their legitimacy. But there could only be one successor to Caesar.

programme.title: Battle For The Atlantic: Greyhound vs Wolfpack - Western Approaches
programme.desc: Men gather for the longest sea battle in history on the Western Approaches.

programme.title: The Dawns Here Are Quiet
programme.desc: It is late spring of 1942, and World War 2 is in full swing. A long way off from the front-line the Germans make an air landing operation in an attempt to get through to the Kirov railway and the White Sea - Baltic Sea Canal. The only obstacle in their way is an anti-aircraft artillery unit of corporal Vaskov and five young women in training.

programme.title: The Ace's War
programme.desc: At the dawn of the 20th Century, the future of aviation is in the hands of a few visionaries and daredevils. In 1903 American brothers Wilbur and Orville Wright make four flights of a few dozen meters on a North Carolina beach. The age of the pioneers ends suddenly in 1914 with the outbreak of the First World War.

programme.title: Napoleon Bonaparte: The Russian Campaign
programme.desc: Part 2 details the hardships and deprivations suffered by Napoleon's Grande Armee as they await the surrender of the Tsar, which never comes. And with problems in France and his popularity waning, Napoleon begins the long, death-filled retreat from Russia with his exhausted, starving troops.
